headline: Chipmaker NXP could make up to 10% of revenue from India by 2030, executive says
summary: NXP Semiconductors could generate between 8% and 10% of its revenue from India over the next three to five years, a senior executive told Reuters on Monday, underscoring rising interest in the country's nascent chip market.  India's growing automotive and industrial sectors are expected to boost the company's sales in the region, NXP India head Hitesh Garg said on the sidelines of an industry event in the tech hub of Bengaluru.  "Next three to five years is the time when India is going to become very significant for NXP as a market where we also generate a lot of revenue," he said.
